title: Elmo Bovio
text:
Elmo Bovio (July 14, 1925 – August 26, 2017) was an Argentine professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Career.
Born in <a href="Jun%C3%ADn%2C%20Buenos%20Aires">Junín, Buenos Aires</a>, Bovio began playing football with local side <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Sarmiento">Club Atlético Sarmiento</a>. Next, he moved to Uruguay, where he helped <a href="Pe%C3%B1arol">Peñarol</a> win the domestic title. Spells abroad with <a href="Inter%20Milan">Inter Milan</a>, <a href="Sociedade%20Esportiva%20Palmeiras">Sociedade Esportiva Palmeiras</a>, <a href="S%C3%A3o%20Paulo%20FC">São Paulo FC</a> and <a href="Am%C3%A9rica%20de%20Cali">América de Cali</a> would follow. He died in August 2017 at the age of 92.
